snippet: Under the policy, the children of gay couples also will now have to wait until they are 18 and out of the home until they can seek formal admission into the church.
abstract: Mormon Church enacts new policies allowing excommunication of people in same-sex marriages and banning children of same-sex couples; hard-line rules sharpen church's doctrinal boundaries, while church has at same time come out against discriminatory policies in employment and housing; opposing stances highlight fine line between church's teachings and changing society.
lead_paragraph: Under the policy, the children of gay couples also will now have to wait until they are 18 and out of the home until they can seek formal admission into the church.
